edu.cpp.cs.cs141.final_project

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.final_project.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the board that the game takes place on. It is composed of the Square class and its extended classes, Room and Hallway.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void assignOffLimits()
      This method sets the spaces closest to the player spawn point as off limits to enemy placement
      boolean checkCaseRoom()
      This method will check to see if the room the player is in front of has the briefcase.
      boolean checkIfEntrance()
      This method checks to see if the square that the player is on is an entrance to a room.
      void checkInvulnerability()
      This mthod will check to see whether or not the Invulnerability power up is still valid.
      void checkRadarEffect()
      This method will turn the lights on in each room if the user has the radar.
      boolean checkValidDirection(java.lang.String agent, int direction, int ninja)
      This method checks to see if the agent can move in the direction it has requested.
      void debugRooms()
      This method checks to see if debug mode is on, then turns on the lights in every room if it is.
      void fillBoard()
      This method makes every single square into a hallway object, which can hold players, enemies, or items
      int getAmmo()
      This method will return the amount of ammo the user has.
      int getNumRooms()
      This method gets the number of rooms for the grid based on the size of the grid.
      int getPlayerLives()
      This method will fill the player array and return their health.
      void getPowerUp()
      This method will allow the user to apply the affect of the power up they pick up.
      void insertBriefcase()
      This method places the briefcase object within one of the rooms at random.
      private void insertEnemies()
      This method places a number of ninja assassin objects into the grid based on the size of the grid
      private void insertItems()
      This method places the power ups on the board.
      private void insertPlayer()
      This method places the player onto the bottom left square.
      private void locateEnemies()
      This method creates an array containing the locations of each ninja assassin in the grid
      void locateHallways()
      This method creates an array containing the location of each hallway object in the grid.
      void locatePlayer()
      This method creates an array containing the location of the player.
      void locateRooms()
      This method creates an array containing the location of each room object in the grid.
      void lookInDirection(int direction)
      This method will simulate the player using their night-vision goggles to look 2 squares ahead.
      void makeBoard()
      This method initializes the board as an array of square objects.
      void makeRooms()
      This method replaces the hallway object with a room object inside each 3x3 square section of the grid
      void moveAgent(java.lang.String agent, int direction, int ninja)
      This method moves a single ninja to the location its AI has requested.
      void moveNinjas()
      This method moves each ninja's location.
      void printBoard()
      This method calls the UI to print out the entire board in its current state.
      void resetPlayerPos()
      This method will reset the player's position when they are stabbed by a ninja.
      void shoot(int direction)
      This method will simulate the shooting of the gun.
      void stab()
      This method simulates a ninja stabbing the player.
      void toggleDebug()
      This method toggles debug mode.
      boolean tryStab(int ninja)
      This method helps the ninja AI determine whether or not they can stab the player.
      void updateLives()
      This method will update the health of the agent in the board.

        public Board(int size,
             boolean debug)
        This constructor creates a scalable board.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the board as an integer divisible 9
        debug - Whether or not debug mode is on

      • checkValidDirection

        public boolean checkValidDirection(java.lang.String agent,
                                   int direction,
                                   int ninja)
        This method checks to see if the agent can move in the direction it has requested.
        Parameters:
        direction - The integer value representing the direction the ninja wants to move.
        ninja - The integer value representing the ninja in the ninjas array.
        Returns:
        True if the ninja can move in the requested direction, else false.

      • moveAgent

        public void moveAgent(java.lang.String agent,
                      int direction,
                      int ninja)
        This method moves a single ninja to the location its AI has requested.
        Parameters:
        ninja - The integer location of this ninja within the ninjas array
        direction - The integer value representing one of four directions for the ninja to move
